Name: Achad Tarlang
Construction: achad S - neck E; Tarlang [proper name]

Name: Adorn
Construction: [pre-Númenórean]

Name: Aglarond
Construction: agla S - glitter [verb] E; rond S - dome E

Name: Whispering Wood
Citations: Unfinished Tales - Part II - iii: Cirion and Eorl

Name: Halifirien
Citations: Unfinished Tales - Part II - iii: Cirion and Eorl
Construction: hall S - shady E; fair S - mortal E; fîr S - mortals E; hall + fîr > halifir, compound vowel reduction

Name: Amon Anwar
Citations: Unfinished Tales - Part II - iii: Cirion and Eorl
Construction: amon S - hill E; anwar S - awe E

Name: Amon Craban
Construction: Ravenhill > raven + hill > hill of ravens; raven E > craban S; craban : crebain :: raven : ravens; hill E > amon S

Name: Amon Dîn
Construction: amon S - hill E; dîn S - silence E

Name: Amon Fangorn
Construction: Treaberd's Hill E > Hill of Treebeard E; hill E > amon S; Treebeard E > Fangorn S [proper name]; fang S - beard E; orn S - tree E

Name: Amon Hen
Construction: amon S - hill E; hen S - sight E

Name: Amon Lanc
Citations: Unfinished Tales - Part III: The Third Age - The Disaster of the Gladden Fields
Construction: amon S - hill E; lanc S - naked E

Name: Amon Lhaw
Construction: amon S - hill E; lhaw S - ear E > hearing E

Name: Amon Sûl
Construction: amon S - hill E; sûl S - wind / weather E

Name: Andeithel
Construction: langwell > lang + well; lang G > long E > and S; well / spring E > eithel S

Name: Andló
Construction: long marshes E; long E > and S; marshes E > ló S

Name: Andrast
Construction: and S - long E; rasg S - horn E; rast S - cape E

Name: Andrath
Construction: and S - long E; rath S - course / riverbed // stream, Ety/383, LR/Index, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rath&phon=ipa
Notes: Andrath is attested twice in Unfinished tales: once as part of the name Cirith Forn en Andrath, the name of pass taken by the party in The Hobbit, but also as the name of a part of the Greenway between the Barrow Downs and the South Downs, part of the Long Road. I use it here to mean "Long Road", though in the former usage, Unfinished Tales translates it to mean "Long Climb".

Name: Great River
Citations: H, II, VIII, X, XI, XII

Name: Anduin
Citations: LR, FR, VIII, X, XI, XII
Construction: and S - long E; duin S - (large) river E; and + duin > anduin

Name: Langstrand
Construction: lang German - long E; strand German - shore E

Name: Anfalas
Construction: and S - long E; falas S - shore E; and + falas > anfalas, lenition

Name: Angmar
Construction: ang S - iron E; bar S - dwelling / home E; ang + bar > angmar, lenition

Name: River Isen
Construction: isen E - iron E

Name: Angren
Construction: ang S - iron E; angren S - of iron E; * ~en S - of ~ E

Name: Sîr Angren
Construction: sîr S - river E; ang S - iron E; angren S - of iron E; * ~en S - of ~ E

Name: Isengard
Construction: isen E - iron E; -gard E - fortress E

Name: Angrenost
Construction: ang S - iron E; angren S - of iron E; * ~en S - of ~ E; ost S - (fortified) city E

Name: Annen
Construction: long lake E; long E > and S; lake / water E > nen S; and + nen > annen S, lenition

Name: Annon Angrenost
Construction: Gate of Isengard E; gate E > annon S; Isengard E > Angrenost S

Name: Annon Caradhras
Construction: Redhorn Gate E; Redhorn E > Caradhras S; gate E > annon S

Name: Annon Erebor
Construction: Gate of Erebor E; gate E > annon S; Erebor [proper name]

Name: Annon Eryn
Construction: forest gate; long E > and S; forest E > woods E > eryn E; forest gate E > annon eryn S

Name: Annon Thol
Construction: Helm's Gate; gate E > annon S; Helm [proper name] > helm E [literal] > Thôl S; annon + thôl > annon thol, vowel shortening

Name: Annúminas
Construction: annú S - west E; minas S - tower E

Name: Anorien
Construction: Anor S [proper name] - the sun E

Name: Ardhon Iaur Arnor
Construction: ardhon S -- realm E; iaur S -- old E; ar- S -- high E; dor S -- land E; ar + dor > arnor S; old > former > lost

Name: Argirith
Construction: high pass; ar S > high E; cirith S > cleft / pass E; ar + cirith > argirith S, lenition c.f., pel + ar + cir > pelargir

Name: Cirith Forn en Andrath
English Meaning: Northern Pass of the Long Climb
Construction: Northern Pass of the Long Climb; cirith S - cleft / pass E; forn - S - northern E; formen S - north E; en S - of the E; and S - long E; rath S - course / riverbed // stream, Ety/383, LotR/Index, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rath&phon=ipa

Name: Argonath
Construction: ar- S - high E; gond S - stone E; ar + gond + ath > argonath

Name: Arthedain
Construction: ardhon S - realm E; edain S - men E; ardhon + edain > arthedain S

Name: Athrad Bruinen
Construction: Ford of Bruinen; ford E > crossing E > athrad S; crossing E : crossings E :: athrad S: ethraid S; Bruinen S - Loudwater E; nen S - water E; brui S - loud E

Name: Athrad Carag
Construction: Ford of Carrock E; ford / crossing E > athrad S; Carrock E > rock E > carag S

Name: Athrad Iaur
Construction: old ford; ford / crossing E > athrad S; old E > iaur S

Name: Athrad Imladris
Construction: Ford of Rivendell; ford E > crossing E > athrad S; crossing E : crossings E :: athrad S: ethraid S; Rivendell E > Imladris S
Notes: The name "Ford of Rivendell" is used once and only in "The Fellowship of the Ring" to refer to the much more frequently cited "Ford of Bruinen".

Name: Athrad Onodló
Construction: Entwade > Ford of Entwash; ford > athrad; Entwash > Onodló; onod S - ent E; enyd S - ents E

Name: Bamfurlong
Construction: bam - bean E; furlong - field E

Name: Barad Dûr
Construction: barad S - tower E; dûr S - dark, sombre E

Name: Barad Durin
Construction: Durin's Tower > Tower of Durin; tower E > barad S

Name: Brandywine
Construction: baranduin S > brandywine E, adoption by similar sound and fitting meaning

Name: Baranduin
Construction: baran S - brown E; duin S - (large) river E

Name: Baranduiniant
Construction: baranduin + iant; iant S - bridge E; baran S - brown E; duin S - (large) river E

Name: Barannor
Construction: dun E > brown E > baran S; land E > dôr S; baran + dôr > barannor, c.f., ennorath

Name: Barannorath
Construction: The Brown Lands E; baran S - brown E; dôr S > land E; baran + dôr > barannor, lenition, vowel reduction, c.f., ennorath

Name: Barion
Construction: Great House; house E > home / dwelling E > bar S, c.f., Angmar; great E > -ion S

Name: Belegaer
Construction: great E > beleg S; sea E > aer S

Name: Belfalas
Construction: beleg S - great E; falas S - shore E

Name: Beorn
Citations: H, I, II, V, Etym., VIII, XII

Name: Beraid Gondor
Construction: Towers of Gondor E; tower E - barad S; towers E - beraid S

Name: Bruinen
Construction: brui S - loud / noisy E; nen S - water E

Name: Cair Andros
Construction: cair S - ship E; and S - long E; ros S - foam E

Name: Calembel
Construction: calen S - green E; calembel S - greenham E; calen + b/p~ > calemb~, lenition

Name: Rohan
Construction: rocco Q -- horse E; roch S -- horse E

Name: Calenardhon
Construction: calen S = green E; ardhon S = realm E

Name: Calenhad
Construction: calen S - green E; had S - mound E < may have been back-formed from Calenardhon

Name: Calenrath
Construction: greenway > green + way E; green E > calen S; way > street E > rath S; rath S - course / riverbed // stream, Ety/383, LotR/Index, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rath&phon=ipa

Name: Isenmouthe
Construction: isen - iron E; mouthe - jaws E

Name: Carach Angren
Construction: carach S - jaw E; ang S - iron E; angren S - of iron E; ~en S - of ~ E

Name: Caradhras
Construction: caran S - red E; rasg / rhasg S - horn; caran + rasg > caradhras S, lenition

Name: Carrock
Construction: carr Old English - rock / stone; car Anglo Saxon - rock E

Name: Carag
Construction: carag S - spike / tooth of rock E; carreg Welsh - rock / stone E; carr Old English; car Anglo Saxon - rock E

Name: Sargond
Construction: Carrock > car + rock; car Anglo Saxon > rock E > sarn S; rock / stone E > gond S; sarn + gond > sargond, c.f., morn + gul > morgul

Name: Caras Galadhon
Construction: caras Silvan / S - city / fortress E; galadh Silvan - tree E; galad + on S - of light E; galadh + on > galadhon; ~on S > of ~ E

Name: Caras Perian
Construction: Hobbiton > Hobbit Town; town / city / fortress E > caras Silvan / S; hobbit E > perian S

Name: Carchost
Construction: carch S - fang E; ost S - fort E

Name: Carnen
Construction: caran S - red E; nen S - water E; caran + nen > carnen S

Name: Celduin
Construction: cell S - running E; duin S - (great) river; cel + duin > celduin S, lenition

Name: Celebdil
Construction: celeb S - silver E

Name: Kibil-nâla
Construction: kibil K - silver E; nâla S - path E

Name: Celebrant
Construction: celeb S - silver E; rant S - rivercourse / path / lode / vein E

Name: Cerin Amroth
Construction: cerin S - mound E

Name: Cîl Rohan
Construction: Gap of Rohan E; gap E > cîl S, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=c%EEl&phon=ipa

Name: Ciril
Construction: cirith S - cleft / pass E; ril S - giltter E

Name: Cirith Anach
Construction: Pass of Anach E; pass E > cirith S; Anach [proper name]

Name: Cirith Gorgor
Construction: cirith S - cleft / pass E; gorgor S - terror E

Name: Cirith Ungol
Construction: cirith S - cleft / pass E; ungol S - spider E

Name: Cirith Dúath
Construction: cirith S - cleft / pass E; dúath S - shadow E

Name: Bay of Belfalas
Construction: bay E > côf S; great E > beleg S; shore E > falas S; beleg + falas S > belfalas S

Name: Côf Belfalas
Construction: côf S - bay E; beleg S - great E; falas S - shore E; beleg + falas > belfalas S

Name: Côf Lhûn
Construction: côf S - bay E; lhûn S - bay E

Name: Cúnmaeghed Rhúnen
Parts: cún maeghed mae ghed rhún rhúnen en

Name: Dagorlad
Construction: dagor S - battle E; lad S - plain E

Name: Dol Amroth
Construction: dol S - head E - tower [figuratively] E; Amroth [proper name]

Name: Dol Guldur
Construction: dol S - tower E; gûl S - sorcery E; dûr S - dark / sombre E; gûl + dûr > guldur S, vowel shortening

Name: Dor-en-Ernil
Construction: dôr S - land E; en S - of the E; ernil S - [proper name of a prince]

Name: Dorwinion
Parts: dôr dor gwîn gwin win ion on
Construction: dôr S - land E; gwîn S - young E; -on S - great E, as in ardhon; -ion S - (great) realm, as in rhovanion, eregion; dôr + gwîn > dorwin, lenition, vowel shortening
Notes: The meaning of "Dorwinion" is conjectural, based on lines from "The Hobbit" that suggest that this is the land where the elf-king, Thranduil's, folk got their strong wine, which is suspicious since there is little reason to believe that there is a similarity between Sindarin "win" and the similarly sounding English "wine". Parma Eldalamberon 17:191 suggests a new interpretation based on "gwîn", meaning "young".

Name: Drúwaith Iaur
Parts: drû dru drú gwaith waith iaur
Construction: drû S - wild man / wose / púkel-man E; gwaith S - realm E; iaur S - old E; drû + ~ > drú~, compound vowel shortening; ~ + gwaith > ~waith, lenition

Name: Dúnharg
Construction: originally from Danhaerg, meaning "hillside temple", http://www.glyphweb.com/ARDA/d/dunharg.html

Name: Duriniant
Construction: Durin's Bridge; bridge E > iant S

Name: Durthang
Construction: dûr S - dark E; thong S - opression E
Notes: "thong" is explained in the Silmarillion - Elements of Quenya and Sindarin Names

Name: Echor Angrenost
Construction: Ring of Isengard E; Ring E > circle, outer ring E > echor S, as in "rammas echor"; Isengard E > Angrenonst S [proper name]

Name: Eldalondë
Construction: elda Q - elf; londë Q - haven / harbor E
Notes: Attested as a name in Númenor

Name: Edhellond
Construction: edhel S - elf E; lond S - haven / harbor E

Name: Elostirion
Parts: el ost tir tira ion on
Construction: el- - elf E; os- < ost - fortified E; tira S - to watch E, as in Minas Tirith

Name: Emyn Arnen
Construction: amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E

Name: Emyn Beraid
Construction: amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E; barad S - tower E; beraid S - towers E

Name: Emyn Formen
Construction: amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E; formen S - north E

Name: Emyn Haeron
Construction: far downs E; downs E > hills E > emyn S; amon S - hill E; far / remote / distant E > haeron S

Name: Emyn Harad
Construction: south downs E; downs E > hills E > emyn S; amon S - hill E; south E > harad E

Name: Emyn Muil
Construction: amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E; muil S - drear E

Name: Emyn Nim
Construction: white downs; downs E > hills E > emyn S; white E > nim S, as in Ered Nimrais; nimp S - pale / white E

Name: Emyn Ring
Construction: Coldfells > cold + fells; fells E > hills E > emyn S; cold E > ring S, as in Ringló

Name: Emyn Sûl
Construction: Weather Hills E; amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E; sûl S - weather E

Name: Emyn Uial
Construction: amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E; uial S - twilight (evening) E; ui S - envelope / heavens; galad S - light E; ui + galad > uial S

Name: Enedwaith
Construction: gwaith S - realm E; enedh S - middle E; enedh + gwaith > enedwaith S, lenition

Name: Ennorath
Construction: earth > land E; middle / core / center E -- enedh S; land E -- dôr S; -ath S -- [collective noun]; enedh + dôr + ath -- ennorath S

Name: Ennyn Moria
Parts: annon ennyn mor môr iâ ia
Construction: annon S - gate - E; ennyn S - gates E; môr S - dark E; iâ - abyss, void; môr + iâ > moria, lenition, vowel shortening

Name: Ephel Duath
Construction: ephel S - outer fence / encircling fence; dû S - darkness / shadow E; gwath S - shade / shadow E; dû + gwath > dúath S - night shade E; -ath S - [collective plural noun]; dúath - darkness; ephel + dúath > ephel duath, vowel reduction

Name: Erebor
Construction: ereb S - lone E; or- S - above E; *ereb + or > erebor S - lonely height E

Name: Erech
Notes: This is a name given either by Númenoreans or early Gondorians, so is probably Adûnaic, Gondorian Sindarin, with the Elvish root of "er" for loneliness.

Name: Ered Angmar
Construction: ered S - mountains E; orod S- mountain E; ang S - iron E; bar S - dwelling / home E; ang + bar > angmar, lenition

Name: Ered Engrin
Construction: amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E; ang S - iron E; angren S - of iron E; ~en S - of ~ E; engrin S - of iron [plural] E

Name: Ered Lasgalen
Construction: analogous to Eryn Lasgalen; mountains E > hills E > emyn S, as in Emyn-nu-Fuin, the name the same range held when Eryn Lasgalen was known as Taur-nu-Fuin; lass S - leaf; calen S - green; lass + calen > lasgalen S, lenition

Name: Emyn Duir
Construction: dûr S - dark / sombre E; duir S - dûr [plural] S; amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E

Name: Emyn-nu-Fuin
Construction: amon S - hill E; emyn S - hills E; nu S - under E; fuin S - shadow E

Name: Ered Lindon
Construction: orod S - moutnain E; ered S - mountains E

Name: Ered Luin
Construction: orod S - mountain E; ered S - mountains E; luin Q - blue E; *elu / elw S - (pale) blue; lhûn S - blue E

Name: Ered Lithui
Construction: orod S - mountain E; ered S - mountains E; lith S - ash / sand / dust E; ui - S - envelope, especially of the Outer Sea or Air enfolding the world within the Ilurambar or world-walls, Ety/397, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=ui&phon=ipa

Name: Ered Mithrin
Construction: orod S - mountain E; ered S - mountains E; mith S - grey E; rîn S - crownèd E

Name: Ered Moria
Construction: mountains of moria; ered S > mountains E; orod S - mountain E; môr S - dark E; iâ - abyss, void; môr + iâ > moria, lenition, vowel shortening

Name: Ered Nimrais
Parts: orod ered nimp nim rais ras
Construction: orod S - mountain E; ered S - mountains E; nimp S - pale / white E; ras S - horn E; rais S - horns E

Name: Eregion
Construction: ereg S - holly tree / thorn E, Etym./356, S/431; -ion S - great (region) E, as in rhovanion, dorwinion

Name: Erelas
Construction: ereb S - lone E; lass S - leaf E; ereb + las > erelas S, lenition

Name: Eriador
Construction: ereb S -- isolated, lonely; dôr S -- land E

Name: Erui
Construction: ereb S - lone E; ui - S - envelope, especially of the Outer Sea or Air enfolding the world within the Ilurambar or world-walls, Ety/397, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=ui&phon=ipa; ereb + ui > erui S, lenition

Name: Tawar-in-Drúedain
Parts: tawar in drû drú dru edain

Name: Eryn Firien
Construction: Firien Wood; wood E > woods E > eryn S; fair S - mortal E; fîr S - mortals E

Name: Eryn Iaur
Construction: Old Forest E; forest E > woods E > eryn S; old E > iaur S

Name: Eryn Lasgalen
Construction: orod S - mountain E; ered S - mountains E; las S - leaf E; calen S - green E; las + calen > lasgalen S, lenition

Name: Taur-e-Ndaedelos
Parts: taur e dae delos ndae ndeaedelos del os
Construction: taur S - forest E; e S - of E; dae S - shadow E; delos S - abhorrence / detestation / loathing E, Etym./355

Name: Taur-nu-Fuin
Construction: taur S - forest E; nu S - under E; fuin S - night / dead of night / gloom / darkness, Ety/354, Ety/382, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=fuin&phon=ipa

Name: Eryn Mithrin
Construction: Grey Wood; wood / woods E > eryn S [plural]; grey E > mithren S; grey [plural] E > mithrin S

Name: Eryn Teryg
Construction: trollshaws E > troll woods > E woods of trolls; woods E > eryn S; trolls E > teryg S; torog S - troll E, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=torog&cognate=troll&phon=ipa

Name: Eryn Uireb
Construction: Everholt E > ever + holt E; ever / eternal E > uireb S, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=uireb&phon=ipa; holt E > woods E > eryn S

Name: Eryn Vorn
Construction: eryn S - woods E; morn S - black / dark E; eryn + morn > eryn vorn S

Name: Eryn Wethrin
Parts: eryn gwathren gwath ren weth wethrin rin
Construction: gwathren S - dim E; gwethrin S - dim [plural] E; eryn S - woods E; oron S - wood E; eryn + gwethrin > eryn wethrin, lenition

Name: Eryndaur
Construction: Chetwood > chet + wood; chet Celtic > forest E; forest E > taur S; woods E > eryn S; eryn + taur > eryndaur S, lenition

Name: Erynduin
Construction: Forest River; forest E > woods E > eryn S; river E > (great) duin S

Name: Erynrath
Construction: Forest Path; forest E > eryn S; path / track E > râd S; road / path E > rath S; eryn + râd > erynrath, lenition; rath S - course / riverbed // stream, Ety/383, LotR/Index, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rath&phon=ipa

Name: Ethir Anduin
Construction: ethir S - mouth of river / estuary E; ed- S - out; sîr S - flow E; ed + sîr > ethir S, lenition; and S - long E; duin S - (great) river E; and + duin > anduin S

Name: Ethir Onodló
Construction: Mouths of Entwash; mouths E > ethir S, as in Ethir Anduin; Onodló S - Entwash, http://www.glyphweb.com/arda/o/onodlo.html; onod S - ent E; lô s - shallow lake, fen land E

Name: Ethraid Erui
Construction: athrad S - crossing / ford E; entraid S - crossings / fords E; erui S - [proper name]; ereb S - lone E; ui S - envelope, especially the Outer Sea of Air enfolding the world within the Ilurambar of world-walls, Ety/397, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=ui&phon=ipa

Name: Ethraid Poros
Construction: crossings of poros; crossings E > ethraid S; Poros S - [proper name]; rhoss S - a whisper or rustling sound; ross S - rain E

Name: Ethring
Construction: ethir S - crossings E; athrad S - crossing E; ring S - cold E

Name: Aldalómë
Construction: alda Q - tree E; lómë Q - night E

Name: Fangorn
Construction: fang S - beard E; orn S - (large) tree E

Name: Fanuidhol
Construction: fanui S - cloudy E; dôl S - head E; dôl - hill or mountain, by extension; fanui + dôl > fanuidhol, lenition, vowel shortening

Name: Fen Chollen
Parts: fen chollen hol len chol phen

Name: Firienfeld
Notes: "A green mountain-field of grass and heath high above the sheer wall of the valley," describes the Firienfeld, in a draft of "Lord of the Rings" published in "The War of the Ring". It is debatable whether this is cannon.

Name: Forannon
Construction: North Gate E; north E > formen S > for- S; gate E > annon S

Name: Forithilien
Construction: forod S - north E; ithil S - the moon E; forod + ~ > for~, lenition

Name: Forlindon
Construction: forod S - north E; forod + ~ > for~ S

Name: Forlond
Construction: forod S - north E; forod + ~ > for~ S; lond S - harbor / haven E

Name: Fornost
Construction: forod S - north E; ost S - (fortified) city / town E; forod + ost > fornost S

Name: Fornost Erain
Construction: forod S - north E; forod + ~ > for~ S; aran S - king E; erain S - kings E

Name: Forochel
Construction: forod S - north E; forod + ~ > for~ S; KHEL - freeze E;

Name: Forodwaith
Construction: northern E -- forod S; realm E -- gwaith S; forod + gwaith S -- forodwaith S

Name: Fortofn
Construction: forod S - north; tofn S - lowlying / deep / low E, "tofn" is transliterated "tovn"; forod + tofn > fortofn; forod + ~ > for~ S

Name: Gilrain
Construction: gîl S - star / bright spark, Ety/358, LotR/E, S/431, RGEO/73, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=g%EEl&phon=ipa; rain S - border E

Name: Glanduin
Construction: glan S - border E; duin S - (great) river E

Name: Glanhír
Construction: glan S - border E; sîr S - river / flow E; glan + sîr > glanhir, lenition, vowel shortening

Name: Gondor
Construction: gond S = stone E; dôr S = land E; gond + dôr > gondor

Name: Gorgoroth
Construction: gorgor S - terror E; groth S - large excavation // delving / underground dwelling, WJ/415, S/431, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=groth&phon=ipa, as in Menegroth, this is the best match for "roth"; roth S - plateau E, presumed based on this attestation

Name: Mount Gundabad
Construction: gunda K - cave / tunnel E

Name: Gundabad
Construction: gunda K - cave / tunnel E

Name: Gwaith Thranduil
Construction: gwaith S - realm / folk E; thranduil S - [proper name of the king of the wood elves, father of Legolas]

Name: Galadhrim
Construction: galad S - light E; -rim S - crowd / host / great number E; rimbë Q - many E; galad + rim > galadhrim, lenitiion

Name: Gwathló
Construction: gwath S - shadow E; lô S - marsh / fenland E; gwath + lô > gwathlo, vowel reduction

Name: Gwathir
Construction: gwath S - shadow E; sîr S - river E; gwath + sîr > gwathir, lenition

Name: Haradwaith
Construction: southern E -- harad S; realm E -- gwaith; harad + gwaith S > haradwaith S

Name: Harithilien
Construction: harad S - south E; ithil S - the moon E; harad + ~ > har~, lenition

Name: Harlindon
Construction: harad S - south E; har + ~ > har~ S; harad + lindon > harlindon

Name: Harlond
Construction: harad S - south E; har + ~ > har~ S; lond S - haven / harbor E

Name: Harnen
Construction: harad S - south E; har + ~ > har~ S; nen S - water, of lakes, pools and lesser rivers, Ety/376, S/435, UT/457, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=nen&phon=ipa

Name: Harondor
Construction: harad S - south E; gond S - stone E; dôr S - land E; gond + dôr > gondor, lenition; har + ~ > har~, lenition

Name: Hartofn
Construction: harad S - south E; tofn S - lowlying / deep / low E, "tofn" is transliterated "tovn"; harad + tofn > hartofn S; harad + ~ > har~ S

Name: Haudh-In-Gwanûr
Construction: haudh S - tomb E; -in- S - of the E; gwanûr S - twins E

Name: Helevorn
Construction: hell S - naked E; morn S - black E; born S - hot / red E; orn S - (any large) tree E

Name: Henneth Annûn
Construction: henneth S - window E; annûn - western / sunset E

Name: Himling
Construction: him S - steadfast / abiding // continually // *cool; lhing / thling S - spider / spider web / cobweb E; gling S - hang / dangle, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=gling&phon=ipa

Name: Hithaeglir
Construction: hith S - mist E; aeglir S - mountain range E

Name: i Drann
Construction: i- S - the E; trann S - shire / administrative district / division of a realm E; i + trann > i-drann, lenition

Name: The Last Bridge
Construction: iant S - bridge; yanta Q - bridge E; medui S - last E; iant + medui > iant vedui, as in ar + medui > arvedui

Name: Iant Vedui
Construction: The Last Bridge; bridge E > iant S; vedui S > medui S > last E, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=medui&phon=ipa

Name: Imlad
Construction: dale E > valley E > imlad S

Name: Imlad Morthond
Construction: black / dark E - morn S; root E - thond S

Name: Imlad Ringló
Construction: imlad S - valley E; ring S - cold E; ló S - marsh E; ringló S [proper name]

Name: Imlad Thôl
Construction: deep E > valley E > imlad S; helm E > thôl S; imlad + thôl > imlad thol, vowel shortening

Name: Imladnûr
Construction: Deeping Comb E; deeping E > deep E > nur S; comb E > narrow valley E > valley E > imlad S; imlad + nûr > imlad nur, vowel shortening

Name: Imladris
Construction: imlad S - valley E; riss S - ravine E

Name: Imrath Gondraich
Construction: imlad S - valley; rath S - course / riverbed // stream, Ety/383, LotR/Index, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rath&phon=ipa; gond S - stone E; raich S - wains E; rach S - wain E

Name: Iorost
Construction: Aldburg > old fortress E; old > iaur; fortress > ost; iorost : iaur + ost :: iorhael : iaur + hael
TODO: Need to get a reference for the attested ior-hael

Name: Írensaga
Construction: íren R - iron E; saga R - saw E
Notes: In old editions, Írensaga appears without an acute accent.

Name: Lanthir Rauros
Construction: lanthir S - waterfall E; rhoss S - whispering or rustling sound E; ross S - rain E

Name: Lebennin
Construction: nîn S - waters / streams E; nen S - water / stream E; leben S - five E

Name: Lefnui
Construction: lefnui S - fifth E, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=lefnui&phon=ipa, transliterated as "levnui"

Name: Lhûn
Construction: lhûn S - blue E

Name: Linhir
Construction: lîn S - pool E; sîr S - stream E; lîn + sîr > linhir, vowel shortening, lenition

Name: Lithlad
Construction: lith S - ash E; lad S - plain E

Name: Lô
Construction: midgewater E > marsh E > lô S

Name: Fenmarch
Construction: march / mark E - border E

Name: Lô Edrein
Construction: Fenmarch > Fen + March; fen E > marsh E > lô S; march / mark E > border E > edrein S, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=edrain&phon=ipa; edrein > ed + rhein; edrein : ed + rhein :: amrún : am + rhûn; glan S - border E, possible alternative

Name: Lô Fern
Construction: Dead Marshes > Marshes of Death; marsh > lô; death > fern

Name: Loeg Ningloron
Parts: loeg ninglor nîn glor glaur nin
Construction: loeg S - pool E; ninglor S - golden water-flower, gladden E; nîn S - water E; glaur S - gold E; nîn + glaur > ninglor

Name: Vinyalonde
Construction: vin- / vinya Q - new; londë Q - haven / harbor E

Name: Lond Daer
Construction: lond S - haven / harbor E; daer S - great E

Name: Lond Daer Enedh
Construction: lond S - haven / harbor E; daer S - great E; enedh S - middle E

Name: Lond Umbar
Construction: haven of umbar; haven E > lond S

Name: Lossarnach
Construction: loss S - flower E

Name: Lossir
Construction: snow E > loss S; river E > sîr S; loss + sîr > lossir

Name: Lothlórien
Construction: loss S - flower E; lórien S - [proper name of one of the Valar, arch-angels] - dream land E

Name: Mallenrond
Construction: Golden Hall E; mallen S - golden colored E; rond S - hall E
Notes: This translation is predicated on the assumption that "golden" in "Golden Hall" refers to the color. There are other Sindarin words for "golden" as in the metal.

Name: Men Eryn Iaur
Construction: old forest road; old E > iaur S; forest E > woods E > eryn E; road E > way E > men S

Name: The Harad Road
Construction: harad S - south E

Name: Men Harad
Construction: the harad road; road E > men S; harad S - south E

Name: Men Rhún-annui
Construction: east / west road E; east E > rhûn S; west E > annui S; road E > way E > men S

Name: Menion Annui
Construction: great west road E; road E > men; -ion S - great E; west E > annui S

Name: Merethrond
Construction: mereth S - feast / festival E; rond S - dome / hall E

Name: Methedras
Construction: methed S - end E; rasg S - horn E; ~ + rasg > ~ras, as in caradhras

Name: Min Firn
Construction: men S - path / road E; min* S / paths E; fern S - dead E; firn* S - dead [plural] E

Name: Minas Morgul
Construction: minas S - tower E; mor S - dark / black E; gul S - sourcery E

Name: Minas Ithil
Construction: minas S - tower E; ithil S - moon / sheen E

Name: Minas Tirith
Parts: minas min as tir tira tirith ith
Construction: minas S - tower E; tir S - to watch / guard E; tirith S - of the watch E

Name: Minas Anor
Construction: minas S - tower E; Anor S - the sun [proper name] E

Name: Mindolluin
Construction: minas S - tower E; dôl S - head E; luin S - blue E

Name: Minhiriath
Parts: min sir sîr sirion ath hir
Construction: min- S - between E; sirion S - river E; -ath S - plural; min + sirion > minhirion S; sirion + ath > siriath S; minhirion + ath > minhiriath S

Name: Mitheithel
Construction: mith S - grey E; eithel S - well / spring E

Name: Mithlond
Construction: mith S - grey E; lond S - harbor / haven E

Name: Mithnen
Construction: Greylin > [river] grey [diminuitive?]; grey E > mith S; river E > waters E > nen S

Name: Morannon
Construction: môr S - dark / black E; annon S - gate E; ennyn S - gates E

Name: Mordor
Construction: môr S = dark E; dôr = land; mor + dor > mordor S

Name: Khazad-dûm
Construction: khazad K - dwarf E; dûm K - delving E

Name: Casarrondo
Construction: casar N - dwarf E; rondo N - dome E

Name: Moria
Construction: môr S - dark E; iâ - abyss, void; môr + iâ > moria, lenition, vowel shortening

Name: Hadhodrond
Construction: hadho S - dwarf E; rond S - dome E

Name: Phurunargian
Construction: phuru W - delving E; nargian W - dwarves E, presumed as "nauco" is Quenya for dwarf

Name: Mornorod
Construction: dwimor E > dark E > morn S; berg E > mountain E> orod S; dwimor possibly from dweomer, magic?  haunted?

Name: River Morthond
Construction: môr S - dark / black E; thond S - root E, LotR/E, Letters/178, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=thond&phon=ipa

Name: Morthond
Construction: môr S - dark / black E; thond S - root E, LotR/E, Letters/178, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=thond&phon=ipa

Name: Nan Curunír
Construction: nan S - valley E; curunír S - Saruman / wizard E; curu S - cunning (device) E

Name: Nanduhirion
Parts: nan dû du hir sîr ion
Construction: nan S - valley E; dû S - dimness E; sirion S - streams E

Name: Nardol
Construction: nor S - fire E; as in Fëanor S; dol S - head / tower E

Name: Nen Cenedril
Construction: Mirrormere > mirror + mere > Lake Mirror; mirror E > cenedril S; mere E > lake / water E > nen S

Name: Oel Cenedril
Construction: Mirrormere > mirror + mere > mere + mirror E; mere E > oel S, as in Nen Hithoel; mirror E > cenedril S

Name: Nen Hithoel
Construction: nen S - water E; nîn S - waters E; hîth S - mist / fog E; oel / ael S - lake / pool / mere E; oelin / aelin S - lakes / pools E

Name: Lake Evendim
Construction: nen S - water E; uial S - twilight E; ui S - envelope / heavens E; galad S - light E; ui + galad > uial

Name: Nenuial
Construction: nen S - water E; uial S - twilight (evening) E; ui S - envelope / heavens; galad S - light E; ui + galad > uial S

Name: Nimrodel
Construction: nimp S - pale / white; rond S - cave E

Name: Nîn-in-Eilph
Construction: nîn S - waters E; nen S - water E; in S - of the E; eilph S - swans E; alph S - swan E

Name: Nindalf
Construction: nîn S - wet - E, talf S - flat field / flat land E; nîn + talf > nindalf, lenition, vowel shortening

Name: Nurn
Construction: nurn S - sad / lament E

Name: Núrnen
Construction: nurn S - sad / lament E; nen S - waters E; nurn + nen > núrnnen

Name: Onodló
Construction: onod S - ent E; enyd S - ents E; lô S - marsh / fenland E; onod + lô > onodlo, vowel shortening

Name: Orod Gram
Construction: Mt. Gram; mountain E > orod S

Name: Orodruin
Construction: orod S - mountain E; ered S - mountains; drúin S - doom [plural] E; drû S - doom E; orod + drúin > orodruin, vowel shortening

Name: Orthanc
Construction: orod S - mountain E; thanc S - fang E; orod + thanc > orthanc S

Name: Osgiliath
Construction: ost S - fortified city or town E; gil S - star E; -ath S - [collective plural noun]; gil-ath > giliath; ost + gil > osgil, lenition
TODO: the translation of "Fort of Stars" is in HoMe according to Eryniel

Name: Ost-in-Edhil
Construction: ost S - fortified city or town E; in S - of the E; edhil S - elves E; ethel S - elf E

Name: Field of Celebrant
Construction: celeb S - silver E; rant S - rivercourse / path / lode / vein E

Name: Parth Celebrant
Construction: Field of Celebrant; field E > parth S; celeb S - silver E; rant S - rivercourse / path / lode / vein E

Name: Parth Galen
Construction: parth S - field E; calen S - green E; parth + calen > parth galen S, lenition

Name: Pelargir
Construction: pel S - fenced field E; ar S - royal E; cîr S - ship E; ceir S - ships E

Name: Pelennor
Parts: pel enedh dôr dor nor en
Construction: pel S - fenced field; enedh S - middle E; dôr S - land E; enedh + dôr > ennor, as in Ennorath; pelen S - of fenced field E, as "angren" is "ang + ren" meaning "of iron"; pelen + dôr > pelennor

Name: Pendlanthir
Construction: Stair Falls; stair E > declivity E > pend S; stairway E > pendrath S, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=pendrath&cognate=stair&phon=ipa; pendrath > pend + rath; rath S > path / way E; stairway : stair :: pendrath : pend, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=pend&phon=ipa; falls / waterfalls E > lanthir S, as in Lanthir Rauros
Notes: It seems likely that "pendlanthir" needs to be normalized through lenition.

Name: Penduireb
Construction: Endless Stair; endless E / eternal E / ever E > uireb S, c.f., nenuial; stair E > pend S; pendrath S - stairway E; rath S - way / road E

Name: Perth Ninglor
Parts: parth perth ninglor nin nîn glor
Construction: Gladden Fields E; fields E > perth S; parth S - field E; Gladden E > Ninglor S

Name: Pindungol
Construction: pend S - stair E; pind* S - stairs E; ungol S - spider E

Name: Pinnath Gelin
Construction: pinnath S - ridges [collective plural noun] E; pinn < pinnath - ridge E; calen S - green E; celin S - green [plural]; pinnath + celin > pinath geiln, lenition

Name: Poros
Construction: rhos S - whisper or rustling sound E; ross / rhoss S - rain E; ross S - red-haired, copper coloured, especially used of animals, as fox, red deer, etc., VT/41:10

Name: Ras Morthil
Parts: ras mor môr morn thil til
Construction: rasg S - horn E; morn S - dark / black E; thil S - sheen E; til S - tine E

Name: Rath Harad
Construction: South Lane E; south E > harad S; lane E > street E > râd S; râd + harad > rath harad, lenition, as in "rath celerdain"; othrad S - street E; imrad S - path E; râd S - path / track E

Name: Südstraße
Notes: "Alte Südstraße" would be direct translation, but is not attested.

Name: Rath Harad Iaur
Construction: Old South Road E; rath S - course / riverbed // stream, Ety/383, LotR/Index, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rath&phon=ipa; harad S - south E; iaur S - old E

Name: Rhimdath
Construction: rim / rhim / rhimb S - crowd / host / great number // cold pool or lake (in mountains) E, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rim&phon=ipa; dath S - hole or pit E, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=dath&phon=ipa

Name: Rhosgobel
Construction: rhos S - whisper or rustling sound E; ross / rhoss S - rain E; ross S - red-haired, copper coloured, especially used of animals, as fox, red deer, etc., VT/41:10; gobel S - walled house or village / town, Ety/380, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=gobel&phon=ipa

Name: Rhovanion
Construction: rovan S -- wild E; rhavan S -- wild man E; rhaw S -- wilderness E; -ion S - (great) realm, as in eregion, dorwinion

Name: Rhudaur
Construction: rhûn S - east E; daur S - forest E; rhûn + daur S > rhudaur S

Name: Rhûn
Construction: rhûn S -- east E

Name: Rhúnaer
Construction: east E > rhûn S; sea E > aer S; rhûn + aer S > rhunaer S, vowel shortening in compound

Name: River Ringlo
Construction: ring S - cold E; lô S - marsh / fenland E; ring + lô > ringlo, vowel shortening in compound

Name: Ringlo
Construction: ring S - cold E; lô S - marsh / fenland E; ring + lô > ringlo, vowel shortening in compound

Name: Rudhras
Construction: Starkhorn > stark + horn E; stark E > bald E > rûdh S; horn E > rasg S > ras S, as in Caradhras, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rasg&cognate=horn&phon=ipa

Name: Sammath Naur
Construction: naur S - fire E; sam S - chamber E; -ath S - [plural]

Name: Sarn Gebir
Construction: sarn S - stone / pebble E; ceber S - stake / spike / stone ridge E; cebir S - stakes / spikes / stone ridges E; sarn + cebir > sarn gebir S, lenition

Name: Sarnathrad
Construction: sarnathrad S - stone ford E, attested; stone E > sarn S, Lost Road / 430; ford E > athrad S

Name: Sarn Athrad
Construction: sarnathrad S - stone ford E, attested; stone E > sarn S, Lost Road / 430; ford E > athrad S

Name: River Celos
Construction: cell S - running E, as in celduin; loss S - flower E

Name: Celos
Construction: cell S - running E, as in celduin; loss S - flower E

Name: Sîr Ninglor
Parts: sîr sir nîn nen glaur glor
Construction: sîr S - stream E; nîn S - waters E; nen S - water E; glaur S - gold E; nîn + glaur > ninglor S, lenition, vowel shortening

Name: Sirith
Construction: sîr S - stream E

Name: Talf Tharn
Construction: withered heath E; withered E > tharn S; heath E > field E > talf, as in "nindalf", TC/195, LotR/Map, http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=talf&phon=ipa

Name: Tharbad
Construction: tharbad S - the crossing place E, http://lotr.wikia.com/wiki/Tharbad

Name: Thranduilrynd
Construction: Elvenking's Halls; Elvenking E > Thranduil S [proper name]; hall E - rond S; halls E - rynd* S

Name: Tol Brandir
Construction: tol S - island E; brand S - lofty / hoble / high (in size), Etym./351, TAI/150, X/ND1

Name: Tolfalas
Construction: tol S - island E; falas S - shore E

Name: Torobrannor
Parts: torog toro brand bran dôr dor nôr nor
Construction: Troll-fells E; troll E > torog S; fells E > highlands E > high + land E; high, lofty E > brand S; land E > nôr S; brand + nôr > brannor, lenition; torog + brannor > torobrannor S, lenition [speculative]

Name: Onobrannor
Parts: onod ono brand bran dor dôr nôr nor
Construction: Ettenmoors E; etten E > ent E > onod S; fells E > highlands E > high + land E; high, lofty E > brand S; land E > nôr S; brand + nôr > brannor, lenition; onod + brannor > onobrannor S, lenition [speculative]

Name: Tyfn
Construction: tofn S - lowland E; tyfn* S - lowlands E

Name: Udûn
Notes: This is possibly Ñoldorin, certainly not Sindarin, since "dûn" would translate to "west".

Name: Umbar
Construction: umbar Q - doom E
